pr_title: [systemtest][refactor] "Generator" for random consumer group names and cleanup

timeline.bodyText: Maybe add a comment explaining its format e.g. my-consumer-group-*-*
timeline.author: samuel-hawker

timeline.bodyText:
I had the same discussion with @see-quick about using two "salts" somehow. I don't think it's useful.
The Random class implements a PRNG (Pseudorandom number generator) so it means that when you use a nextXXX method, it's going to generate the next pseudorandom number in the "sequence", so every nextXXX in the same execution will return you a different number. There is no way it returns the same number as before.
The same sequence could be generated in two different runs of the tests if the "seed" used for initializing the pseudorandom sequence generation is the same. It doesn't happen with the default Random constructor because internally it uses system time as part of the seed, so it's different for every run so the generated sequence of random numbers is different every run.
Anyway, I think that concatenating two random numbers is useless.
Another point is that you should define one Random instance in the class using it. Why creating a new instance every time generateRandomConsumerGroup is called? As I said, it provides you a sequence of random number so each call to nextXXX on the same Random instance cannot return an already generated random number.
timeline.author: ppatierno
